author: sauliusgrigaitis
content: But this data isn’t big and can be kept in memory?

author: sauliusgrigaitis
content: So Grandine tries to keep in memory all the information it needs for the unfinalised part of the chain (it gets a bit more tricky when non-finalisation starts), so in our case we would just store new Electra specific data in-memory. So in our case there isn’t that much benefit of this proposal, but generally it makes sense, especially for clients that are more disk based.

author: potuz
content: this isn't kept in memory, you may need to recover pretty old states to perform a state transition

author: potuz
content: You could be syncing a very old chain to regenerate a state to serve some beacon chain data from a past state.

author: potuz
